website_summaries.verdict: Featuring a collection of carefully curated ingredients known for cultivating beneficial urinary system bacteria and supporting bladder function, this powdered supplement is especially helpful for senior cats.
pros: Organic cranberry powder, D-Mannose, crab and shrimp shells, and marshmallow powder are the first 4 ingredients
cons: This formula is a fairly pricey urinary supplement, but it utilizes premium organic ingredients

customer_reviews.title: Good for dogs and cats. And works.
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our giant breed dog. He had urinary tract problems, and after being neutered, continued to get urinary tract infections. We have given this to him regularly now for the past two years. To date, he has not had one more UTI. The ingredients are natural, there is no need for constant harsh chemicals to be given, and our dog thrives. This is easy to dose, even for a cat, although we hate to give our cats any medicine, because it is kind of like wrangling slippery alligators. When they are having urinary tract issues, we dissolve the powder in water, put it in a syringe and squirt it in the cat's mouth. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a different chew supplement for my senior Sheltie who is having bladder incontinence issues. As well as an Aussie who gets bladder infections easily. I bought the digestive enzymes so I thought I would buy this brand as well. I read the ingredients and was shocked to see the label. “Not for long term use. Contradictory to kidney disorders” What?! I wish I would have read the label more closely before I bought. I’m not sure what the intended use of the supplement is for? Not for long term use? And not for kidney disorders? Non returnable item as well
customer_reviews.author: Ashley R.

customer_reviews.title: The cats aren’t complaining.
customer_reviews.text: Our super picky 9+ year old cats both needed... something. The super expensive dry food the vet gave us a prescription for, they wouldn’t eat. So I mix this, one scoop into a can of “cuts in gravy” canned and give them each half. They eat it all! It helps with the “squeaky cat” bladder issues they had - poor old guys.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Blackthorpe

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT SUPPORT FOR DOGS
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving my Chase Dr. Mercola products for years - he gets more than just this bladder product. Keeps pets healthy and remember - FOOD is extremely important. Feed excellent food, supplement with good, quality products and your fur baby will stay healthy and you will have less vet visits. Chase in going to be 7 in December and sees the vet twice a year for mandatory shots only. Dr. Mercola is a trusted source to help you and your pet to have a good life.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A.

customer_reviews.title: Owner Tested, Daisy Approved  !
customer_reviews.text: My brothers Bichon ,Daisy is prone to having bladder crystals. Previously had gone thru 2 surgeries to remove them . After keeping her on this we. watch her PH levels and she is good . It has been 1 1/2 year with no sign of bladder infection at all. Such a relief knowing she will not have to have anymore painful surgeries.

customer_reviews.text: This product keeps my 3 boy cats, who have FLUTD , healthy.

customer_reviews.title: It works for older dogs with bladder problems

A small amount on their daily food helps them to hold their urine long enough to get them outside to do their business. It works and it’s safe. Thanks Dr. Mercola!

customer_reviews.title: it has helped

customer_reviews.author: corinne b.

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is great and I love the idea of my dog not ...
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great and I love the idea of my dog not having to be on rx food; however, I ordered 2 jars of this and they both expired on 2/2013-so this was pretty upsetting to have spent money for this product, only for it to be expired almost 2 years ago. If it expired and there wasn't any new product, it should have been taken off as available for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DTJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our 1/2 mutt, 1/2 Maine Coon boy with bladder/urinary crystal issues. It really helps to keep him urinating regularly. I feel it is well worth the price since he will not eat prescription food from the vet. This product with some wet food twice per day and urinary tract formula dry keep him from getting sick. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 2 Cool Chicks (3/30/04)

customer_reviews.title: Helped our 12 year old Australian Shepherd female stop leaking in her sleep.
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have found these herbs to give our 12 year old Australian Shepherd female. She was beginning to wet herself in her sleep almost daily recently and since she has been on the herbs she has only done it maybe twice since then. I would highly recommend this product. So happy this was able to help her. I read that female dogs can have this problem from being spayed and stretched too far on the operating table so in the future I will make sure to talk with the vet so that this problem can be avoided completely.
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it, but it came without a scoop!
customer_reviews.text: Got this after my cat had PU surgery due to a blockage. He got a UTI from being catheterized and we anticipate more UIT's because of the surgery. Seems to have worked, but he is peeing A LOT. Biggest downside is that it didn't come with a scoop. I don't have a scale that goes down to small enough increments to figure out how much to feed. Had to have my wife take it into her research lab to use a scale and figure it out. Not sure how someone without that resource would do it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Helped elderly cat with UTI
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help our elderly cat when she had what I believed to be a UTI. I believe this combined with giving her Apple cider vinegar at each feeding (but follow product directions at once a day) helped her get over the UTI but it did take awhile. We continue using this in hopes of not to seeing her go thru that again.
customer_reviews.author: Castle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: My picky tabby cat must really like the flavor of this stuff because he does not mind at all when I mix it into his food. Hoping this well help him from having any recurrences of his struvite stones.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Has kept bladder stones at bay.
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr old cat started going outside the litter box and noticed blood in his urine. He ended up having surgery to remove bladder stones. I started him on this supplement and he starts licking it up before I get a chance to add canned food to mix in. It’s been a year and he hasn’t had any problems since.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think it was going to work but it did.

The vet put her on proin which worked well until she started having diarrhea. I gave this a try and it didn't seem to be helping until I almost finished the 1st jar. I was thinking I wouldn't be buying a second jar then I started noticing she wasn't leaving wet places on the floor anymore. I will be keeping it on hand and think I will start giving it to our new 10 month old miniature schnauzer who seems to have some difficulty urinating.

She became violently ill on the third day she took this, her eyes swelled to the point of blindness, so I had to take her to the vet and ended up spending 110 dollars on her medication.

Harvey is 100% and back to himself after a long 7 week ordeal. He will continue on this regimen for the rest of his life. Thank you SO much....

I work from home so i am able to see when she leaks, and i definitely notice a very huge difference when she is consistently on this product. I highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: What to say
customer_reviews.text: Our dog pees all over the house, he is 15! We thought initially it was old age, Dimensia or some other old age issue, so we tried and it didn't work. We have since learned it is all behavioral with this dog, he is mad atus and pees vengefully, he goes outside for the "other" potty break and would never do that in the house, so don't assume this product doesn't work if it does not stop your dog, it could behavioral. We now know our dog is doing it bc he is mad about something.

product_meta.title: Dr. Mercola, Bladder Support, for Cats and Dogs, 9.5 oz (270g), with Organic Cranberry Extract and D-MannosePromotes Optimal Urinary Tract Health and Function, Non GMO, Soy Free, Gluten Free
feature_bullets: Each Container of Bladder Support for Cats and Dogs Contains 9.5 oz (270g)
Following Dr. Mercola’s belief in providing the best quality products, this product is Gluten free, GMO free, Soy Free
Provides bladder and urinary tract support for both cats and dogs.
Contains Organic Cranberry Extract and D-Mannose, along with 7 other active ingredients.
All Dr. Mercola products are backed by a full 90-day money back guarantee. If for any reason you are not satisfied with your purchase, simply return it to us for your money back - no questions asked.
